summary: Asynchronously reads the entire contents of a file specified by the path and returns it as a string.
Synchronously reads and returns the contents of a text file given its file path.
Reads a file asynchronously and returns its contents as a list of strings, one for each line.
Asynchronously writes a string content to a specified file, overwriting existing data.
Synchronously appends the given text to the end of a file specified by the file path.
Checks asynchronously if a file exists at the specified path and returns a boolean.
Asynchronously copies a file from a source path to a destination path.
Deletes a file at the specified path asynchronously if it exists.
Asynchronously gets the length of the file in bytes.
Returns the last modified time of the file at the given path asynchronously.
Reads the file and returns the first line, or an empty string if the file is empty.
Encodes a map to JSON and writes it asynchronously to a file at the specified path.
Synchronously reads all lines from a file and returns them as a list of strings.
Renames a file from the old path to the new path asynchronously.
Reads the entire contents of a file as a list of bytes asynchronously.
Writes a list of bytes to a file asynchronously, overwriting existing content.
Creates a directory asynchronously, including any necessary parent directories.
Opens a read stream for the file at the specified path.
Opens a write stream (IOSink) for the file at the specified path.
Attempts to read a file as a string and returns null if an error occurs, printing the error.

Returns the path of the parent directory for a given file path.
Checks synchronously if the path points to a file.
